intro: [WRONG START] Pleurotholis gutierrezii, commonly known as the Guiterrez's orchid, is a species of orchid native to the Andes region of South America. It is a small, epiphytic plant that typically grows on trees in humid, shaded forest environments. The plant produces delicate, fragrant flowers in shades of white and pale pink, often with intricate patterns on the petals. It belongs to the Orchidaceae family and is characterized by its specialized root system that allows it to absorb moisture and nutrients from the air. Due to its habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
